result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:59 pm - Defendant William M. Lowe appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-07-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of  discharge bodily fluids at public safety worker, threats to law enforcement officer and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-12-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.  Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
